diagnosis: Hard impact on Joint 1 with high severity; peak torque at 41.74% suggests abrupt external load. Temperature alert indicates possible motor or reducer thermal stress after collision.
inspection_steps:
- Visually inspect J1 housing for cracks or deformation
- Check motor temperature logs and verify sensor accuracy
- Inspect reducer backlash and listen for abnormal noise
- Review torque-time profile around impact
- Verify wiring/connectors for heat damage
maintenance_actions:
- Perform J1 recalibration and zeroing
- Apply thermal diagnostic test and re-grease reducer if needed
- Tighten or replace any stressed fasteners
- Run friction/drag characterization on J1
- Update collision counters and reset thermal alarms after verification
safety_clearance:
- Confirm no structural deformation
- Ensure motor temperature returns to nominal range
- Validate joint torque response under low-load test
return_to_service:
- Run slow-speed functional test
- Gradually increase load while monitoring temperature and torque
- Clear event logs
- Release robot for normal operation if all readings remain stable

diagnosis: J1 experienced a high‑severity hard impact with torque reaching 64.47% of its rated limit, indicating a sudden external collision or abrupt mechanical stop that may have caused encoder offset, minor shaft deflection, or preload disturbance in the joint assembly.
inspection_steps:
- Visually inspect J1 housing and linkage for deformation or fastener loosening
- Check cable strain relief and connector seating near the J1 axis
- Review motor current logs for anomalies around the impact timestamp
- Verify encoder readings for drift or inconsistent position feedback
- Manually move the joint (power‑off) to feel for binding or abnormal resistance
maintenance_actions:
- Perform a full J1 encoder recalibration
- Re‑torque J1 mounting hardware to manufacturer specifications
- Lubricate the J1 drive components if lubrication interval is near threshold
- Run a low‑speed homing cycle to confirm positional stability
- Clear collision fault codes and revalidate torque sensing
safety_clearance:
- Confirm no structural damage to arm segments
- Validate joint motion without load under supervised mode
- Ensure collision detection thresholds remain within nominal limits
return_to_service:
- Run full joint self‑test
- Perform a dry‑run cycle of typical motions
- Reintroduce operational load gradually while monitoring torque
- Approve return to automatic operation if no anomalies are detected

diagnosis: Emergency stop was manually triggered during motion on Joint 1. Torque spike was moderate but below structural risk threshold. Likely operational intervention rather than mechanical failure, but J1 should be inspected for unintended resistance or encoder drift.
inspection_steps:
• Inspect J1 harness and connectors for strain or pull marks
• Check J1 brake release/re-engagement behavior
• Verify encoder alignment and look for post-E-stop drift
• Review controller logs for pre-stop anomalies
• Confirm physical environment for obstruction or human interference
maintenance_actions:
• Perform joint calibration verification on J1
• Re-torque external fasteners to spec
• Execute motor/gearbox temperature and vibration check
• Test E-stop circuit continuity and debounce performance
• Update protective stop thresholds if false triggers suspected
safety_clearance:
• Ensure workspace is free of obstructions
• Confirm E-stop functionality with controlled test
• Validate operator clearance and guarding
return_to_service:
1. Power-cycle controller and clear E-stop latch
2. Run low-speed J1 motion test
3. Execute full-axis homing
4. Perform supervised cycle at reduced speed
5. Approve for normal operation if no anomalies occur

diagnosis: Emergency stop was manually triggered during motion on Joint 1. Torque stayed within safe range but sudden halt may have introduced minor mechanical stress and potential encoder offset.
inspection_steps:
- Inspect J1 housing for impact marks or binding
- Check J1 motor temperature history and verify no overheating
- Review E-stop button function and confirm no intermittent faults
- Verify J1 encoder alignment and signal integrity
- Pull controller logs for any concurrent faults
maintenance_actions:
- Perform J1 encoder recalibration
- Re-grease J1 harmonic drive if lubrication interval is near threshold
- Verify torque sensor baseline and re-zero if drift is detected
- Run low-speed motion test for J1 to detect abnormal resistance or noise
safety_clearance:
- Confirm E-stop circuit integrity
- Verify no mechanical obstruction on J1
- Ensure operator lockout/tagout removed and interlocks engaged
return_to_service:
- Power-cycle controller
- Run J1 homing routine
- Execute incremental speed motion test
- Resume standard operations if all checks pass
